title: Cannot convert RandomForestClassifier when model labels is a 2d array
body:
Hi there,

I've got a trained RandomForestClassifier. X_train.shape is (73578, 18). y_train.shape is (73578, 2). Initially, the model was trained using pandas dataframes, but I eventually converted them to numpy arrays. Both features and targets are integers. For further clarification, types of observations and targets are integers (dtype('int64'))

I follow the instructions:

```python
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier

model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=30,
                               min_samples_leaf=2,
                               min_samples_split=2,
                               max_depth=15,
                               oob_score=True,
                               random_state=44)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

from skl2onnx import convert_sklearn
from skl2onnx.common.data_types import Int64TensorType

initial_type = [('input', Int64TensorType([None, 18]))]
onx = convert_sklearn(model, initial_types=initial_type)

with open("cool_model.onnx", "wb") as f:
    f.write(onx.SerializeToString())
```

The conversion and serialization work, apparently, fine. However, when I try to load it again an run it using the ONNX Runtime:

```python
import onnxruntime as rt
sess = rt.InferenceSession("cool_model.onnx")
```

It fails:

```
[ONNXRuntimeError] : 6 : RUNTIME_EXCEPTION : Exception during initialization: /onnxruntime_src/onnxruntime/
core/providers/cpu/ml/zipmap.cc:42 onnxruntime::ml::ZipMapOp::ZipMapOp(const onnxruntime::OpKernelInfo&) 
classlabels_strings_.empty() ^ classlabels_int64s_.empty() was false. Must provide classlabels_strings or 
classlabels_int64s but not both.
```

Any idea of why it is failing?

Thanks
